answers.text: Define the proper use of an identifier
Define a loop or an if statement

quizzes.question: Data types are intended to:
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Data Types[/h1]

The operating system allocates memory and selects what will be stored in the reserved memory based on the variable's [b]data type[/b].
The data type defines the proper use of an identifier, what kind of data can be stored, and which types of operations can be performed.
[note]There are a number of built-in types in C++.
Tap [b]Continue [/b]to learn more![/note]

quizzes.question: Which of the following expressions are legal in C++?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Expressions[/h1]

The examples below show legal and illegal C++ expressions.[code format="cpp" ]55+15 //  [b]legal [/b]C++ expression
//Both operands of the + operator are integers

55 + "John" // [b]illegal[/b]
// The + operator is not defined for integer and string

"Hello," + "John" // [b]legal
[/b]// The + operator is used for string concatenation[/code]

quizzes.question: Which of the following are correct values for the numeric data types?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Numeric Data Types[/h1]

Numeric data types include:
[b]Integers[/b] (whole numbers), such as -7, 42.
[b]Floating point [/b]numbers, such as 3.14, -42.67.
[note]We'll explain more about data types in the lessons to come.[/note]

quizzes.question: Which one is a legal character, not a string?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Strings & Characters[/h1]

A [b]string [/b]is composed of numbers, characters, or symbols. String literals are placed in [b]double quotation[/b] marks; some examples are "Hello", "My name is David", and similar.

[b]Characters [/b]are single letters or symbols, and must be enclosed between [b]single quotes[/b], like 'a', 'b', etc.
[note]In C++, single quotation marks indicate a [b]character[/b]; double quotes create a [b]string [/b]literal. While 'a' is a single a character literal, "a" is a string literal.[/note]

quizzes.question: What is the result of 10 == 10 operation? Is it true or false?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Booleans[/h1]

The Boolean data type returns just two possible values: [b]true [/b](1) and [b]false [/b](0).
[note][b]Conditional expressions[/b] are an example of Boolean data type.[/note]
